page.title: 04A TYPICAL FARM
page.content: The farm chosen for this topic is Little Knowle Farm which is situated approximately 1.5 miles South West of Holsworthy.The farm is owned by one Mr.Hayes,who has been farming since leaving school.The size of this typical farm is 145 acres,which includes pasture,arable land,woodland, and farm buildings. The main type of farming conducted at Little Knowle Farm and indeed all the other surrounding farms is dairy farming.Mr Hayes has a herd of 80 fresian dairy cattle,which on average will produce 700 litres of milk per day.The milk is collected by tanker every morning at 11:00.The heavy clay soils and wet climate favour dairy farming as the drainage is unsuitable and unproffitable for arable farming. The farm house is a traditional Cob building.(mixture of clay & straw).
